      Throws:

  • Method Details

    • getGames

      public List<Game> getGames()
      Returns:
      a list of Game objects representing all the games managed by the controller

    • getGame

      public Game getGame(int id)
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier of the game to be retrieved
      Returns:
      the Game object matching the specified ID, or null if no matching game is found

    • getGameFromNickname

      public Game getGameFromNickname(String nickname)
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the player whose associated game is to be retrieved
      Returns:
      the Game object associated with the given nickname, or null if no game is found

    • onActionReceived

      public void onActionReceived(PlayerAction action) throws InvalidActionException, InvalidStateException
      Handles the reception and processing of a player action within the associated game context. It verifies the legitimacy of the action, executes it if valid, updates the game state accordingly, broadcasts the updated game snapshot and operation logs to all connected players.
      Parameters:
      action - the player action to be processed.
      Throws:
      InvalidActionException - if the action is deemed invalid for the player (e.g., the player is retired and cannot perform actions).
      InvalidStateException - if the action is inconsistent with the current state of the game or player.

    • onInitActionReceived

      public void onInitActionReceived(InitAction action) throws InvalidActionException
      Handles the processing of an initial action received within the game system. It validates and executes the provided InitAction, updates game states and connected players, and broadcasts relevant updates to recipient players, including game snapshots, logs, and joinable game information.
      Parameters:
      action - the InitAction to be processed.
      Throws:
      InvalidActionException - if the action is deemed invalid by the validation process.

    • addGame

      public void addGame(Game game)
      Adds a game to the games collection managed by the controller. Updates the tracking structures for the game and its associated players.
      Parameters:
      game - the Game object to be added. This object contains the players and other game-related information.

    • getJoinableGames

      public List<Game.GameInfo> getJoinableGames()
      Returns:
      a list of GameInfo objects representing the joinable games.

    • getRecipientsForJoinableGames

      public List<String> getRecipientsForJoinableGames()
      Returns:
      a list of nicknames of players who are currently not associated with any game and can receive joinable game notifications.

    • isNickNameTaken

      public boolean isNickNameTaken(String nickname)
      Checks whether a given nickname is already associated with a game in the system.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname to be checked for existence in the system
      Returns:
      true if the given nickname is already taken, false otherwise

    • addConnectedPlayer

      public void addConnectedPlayer(Game game, Player player)
      Adds a player to the set of connected players for the specified game.
      Parameters:
      game - the game to which the player is being connected
      player - the player to be added to the game's list of connected players

    • addNicktoGame

      public void addNicktoGame(String nickname, Game game)
      Associates a player's nickname with a specific game in the system.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the player to be linked to the specified game
      game - the game to which the nickname is being associated

    • disconnect

      public void disconnect(String nickname)
      Disconnects a player identified by their nickname from their associated game. The player is removed from the list of connected players for the game and added to the list of disconnected players. Notifies the game about the player's disconnection.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the player to be disconnected

    • propertyChange

      public void propertyChange(PropertyChangeEvent evt)
      Handles property change events.
      Specified by:
      propertyChange in interface PropertyChangeListener
      Parameters:
      evt - the property change event containing the property name, source, and new value related to the change. The "source" is expected to be the game ID (Integer), and the "new value" is expected to represent the timer number that expired.
